title: Rachel Dolezal's Story Sparks Questions About 'How People Experience Race'
teaser: NPR's Audie Cornish talks with Rutgers University professor Khadijah White and Allyson Hobbs, who wrote a book about the history of racial passing, about the former head of the NAACP in Spokane, Wash.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
